description: Unique surrogate key for the time zone record, used for lookups and joins across the system.
Standard offset from Coordinated Universal Time, in hours (supports fractional minutes), excluding any daylight saving adjustment; negative values indicate locations west of UTC.
Long-form name used when daylight saving time is observed; may be blank or a placeholder for regions that do not switch.
User-facing label combining GMT offset and representative locations for selection in settings, lists, and reports.
Canonical time zone key used to map to operating-system or library definitions; likely a Windows time zone ID; confirm with SME.
Long-form name used during standard time (non‑daylight‑saving period) for the zone.
Indicates whether the zone observes daylight saving time and switches between standard and daylight rules.
Abbreviated code for the zone used in displays and reports; not guaranteed to be globally unique.
